title: Which subject do we study after 10th to become a journalist? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey, You can pursue diploma in journalism at 10+2 with minimum aggregate of 50% with either science subjects. Diploma in journalism is 2 year course which costs about INR 10,000 to 5 lakh. The main entrance exam conducted for admission to the course in the country is by Indian Institute of Mass Communication (IIMC)- a government institute under the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (MIC). To get admission in some colleges you will also need to clear their respective entrance exams. However, if you want a degree in journalism (I.e. BA Journalism) then you must have minimum aggregate of 50% with art subjects. This is a 3 year course and costs about INR 30,000 to 3 lacs. Other related courses of journalism are: BA JournalismBA Journalism and Mass CommunicationBA Journalism in EnglishMA journalismMA Journalism and Mass CommunicationI hope I’m helpful. Looking forward to hearing from you in case you have any further queries.
